head.title: High-Rise for Seniors Opens in Yonkers

hedline.hl1: High-Rise for Seniors Opens in Yonkers

abstract.p: Divison of Hyatt hotel company, in partnership with Forest City Daly developers, opens Classic Residence by Hyatt, new high-rise for seniors, in Yonkers, NY (S)

block.p: The first residents are moving into a new high-rise for seniors built in Yonkers by a division of the Hyatt hotel company in partnership with Forest City Daly developers. The 17-story building has 310 apartments, with mostly independent living units, a personal care section and an area for Alzheimer's sufferers.
Prices start at $3,450 a month, which includes meals and a variety of services.

The first residents are moving into a new high-rise for seniors built in Yonkers by a division of the Hyatt hotel company in partnership with Forest City Daly developers. The 17-story building has 310 apartments, with mostly independent living units, a personal care section and an area for Alzheimer's sufferers.
Prices start at $3,450 a month, which includes meals and a variety of services.
The building, called Classic Residence by Hyatt, is on the Riverdale border, and overlooks the Palisades, said Steven J. Cohen, executive director of the project.

It cost $70 million and received a $40,000-a-year tax abatement over the next decade from the Yonkers Industrial Development Agency, said Edward A. Sheeran, the agency's executive director. The complex will provide 110 jobs and $700,000 a year in property tax revenue, he said.
